Articles.Content:
With mountains sticking above atmosphere.

Definitely something to keep in mind...

Current idea I'm working on for fearless.

Next up will be Peabody, should have several atmosphere piercing plateaus hopefully.
*tinker tinker*
It would be cool for with planet with mountains sticking outside of the atmosphere to have clouds or something, they could look amazing from the top of the plateaus.
I just landed a rover onto Boris. It's definitely the best planet I've landed a rover on so far!! Great job! I will post some pictures.
not sure how the cloud thing works, but I'm working on the atmo thing

Rover on Boris

http://i950.photobucket.com/albums/ad343/Larry_M/KSP2014-02-2016-07-43-27.jpg

I used seven chutes at the end of the decent and still blew out 4 of the 6 tires. Good thing the Kerbalnots can fix them. It's pretty challenging as is! The ground is a bit soft but doesn't seem to bother the rover. This is a great planet, don't change it!

http://i950.photobucket.com/albums/ad343/Larry_M/KSP2014-02-2015-51-14-58.jpg

I used seven chutes at the end of the decent and still blew out 4 of the 6 tires. Good thing the Kerbalnots can fix them. It's pretty challenging as is! The ground is a bit soft but doesn't seem to bother the rover. This is a great planet, don't change it!

http://i950.photobucket.com/albums/ad343/Larry_M/KSP2014-02-2015-51-14-58.jpg

That's what I had in mind when I made it, very very thin atmosphere, the chutes will only slow you down a bit, drouges are quite handy in this one as well due to the fact they open earlier and with less pressure. You might even manage to use them for aerobraking if you find the right spot to skim over the surface.

The atmosphere does have some oxygen in it, so that's a possibility for a jet return vessel.

You basically can turn sideways right after launch and build up speed until you run out of atmosphere, or you slam into a mountain. (The atmospheric pressure gives out well before the mountains do usually)

Edited February 21, 2014 by medikohl

The only change I may make to boris is the orbit, I might make it less eccentric/inclined and bring it in a bit
